Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: New Year's flask
Description: New Year's flask with a spherical body and a short neck ending in a very thick flaring lip, which resembles a dish.  Two vertical loop handles join the neck to the body.  The mouth is 1,5 cm in diametre. The clay is fine, pink and bears concentric throwing marks.
